stimulusHtml: A beam of light travels through materials 1, 2, and then 3, as shown. Wave fronts of the beam within each material are represented as parallel lines. Which of the following is a correct statement about the propagation speed of light in these materials?
choicesHtml: The propagation speed in material 2 is equal to the propagation speed in materials 1 and 3, because the propagation speed of light is c.
The propagation speed in material 2 is higher than the propagation speed in materials 1 and 3, because the wave fronts are farther apart.
The propagation speed in material 2 is lower than the propagation speed in materials 1 and 3, because the angle of the beam entering and leaving material 2 is steeper than within this material.
The propagation speed of material 3 cannot be compared with that of material 1, because these materials are not adjacent to one another.
